name: La Copa Inn Beach Hotel

reviews.text: This is the third time we come to the hotel, but this is the last time. Someone got into our room and stole while we were at the beach, no one cared, management didn't even want to speak to us. If you need to feel safe this is not the place for you.
reviews.title: Beware of thieves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had found a Travelzoo offer for this resort on South Padre, so reserved it for 4 nights. We upgraded to a balcony overlooking the ocean. This included daily breakfast and 2 drinks pp every evening from 4:00 to 7:00 PM. The drinks were: a marguerita on the rocks, beer, wine or a soft drink. All served in a small plastic cup except for the soft drink which was in the can. Popcorn was offered with the drinks.
reviews.title: Not What We Expected but OK for the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed when we checked in at the front desk that we were given the "last available room" and it was NOT a balcony overlooking the ocean, but a ground floor room right outside the swimming pool area. The desk clerk was totally not concerned but did offer to refund the taxes paid. Since we had paid Travelzoo up front, we couldn't cancel or get our money back. So we just sucked it up and stayed.
reviews.title: Good for the value

reviews.text: The room was just fine, with 2 good beds and a nice sitting area with a good TV, refrigerator, and microwave. The bathroom had nice towels and tiny bars of soap but they were replaced daily.
reviews.title: Beware additional charges after check out!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, with waffles daily and another hot dish served daily
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: I purchased a travelzoo voucher for this hotel and it appeared to be a good deal. I noticed in the fine print that there was a lot of blackout dates which made travel during the voucher dates very limited. I called to book the room on MAY 23rd which was a valid date and didn't fall in one of the blackout periods. I called and spoke to someone who booked the room for me and gave me a confirmation number. Then I received a call back after I had already requested vacation from my employer and was told my reservation was not valid. The voucher read "valid on ARRIVALS through MAY 24th" but since I was staying the23rd and 24th it was not valid. Even though I was arriving on the 23rd and the voucher read valid for arrivals through MAY 24th.
reviews.title: Be careful using travelzoo vouchers with this resort, because they are misleading

reviews.text: Our stay at the hotel was gorgeous, we had an oceanview room,the room was clean and neath, the staff at the frontdesk was very helpfull and friendly, the breakfast was very good with scrambled eggs,flour tortillas,refried beans. Defenetly we come back to la copa
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: We decided for whatever bizarre reason to take our chihuahua with us on a family post-Christmas vacation, along with a 2-year-old, a 4-year-old and a teenager. Chihuahua loved the pet relief station downstairs. Teenager loved the epic Texas-shaped Belgian waffles (oh my goodness, those were good). Come to think of it, my husband did, as well. What we were after was exactly what we got: A clean (but not amazing) room with everything we needed, a good breakfast, a quick jaunt to the beach (out the back door and across a wooden walkway, and you're there!), and a price that made it worthwhile. We got oodles of drink coupons when we arrived and used precisely zero of them, but that would have been a nice perk. The concierge was helpful pointing us to various area attractions, as we'd never been there before. All in all, we had no complaints about, well...anything. We were on the 4th floor, but not beach-view side, and there was no noise to speak of. Everything seemed in good shape - comfy beds, nice little balcony, neat bathroom. Again, we had no complaints at all and would not hesitate to return to La Copa if we hit South Padre again. In fact, it's not always easy to find places that are dog-friendly, so that's a rather big plus if you do find yourself traveling with your pooch.
reviews.title: 3 kids + 1 dog + La Copa = pretty satisfying stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Copa doesn't bill itself as a 5 star resort, nor did we expect one, but did expect things to be as advertised. Most places we stay either meet or exceed their advertisements, but La Copa fell short. We requested a 4th floor beach view room which at the time of booking they said ok. Upon arrival no 4th floor rooms available, but was offered a 2nd floor beach view. Good view, but more noisey as it sat over the pool area. They advertise wifi in all rooms, but to get internet we had to go out of our room, and about 30 feet into the main hallway. When we asked about this just got a blank oh well stare. Nice flatscreen TV, but most channels fuzzy. The room was nice, clean, and staff friendly although most had very little grasp of the English language, so each question was an adventure. On our next trip to South Padre we will be looking for a different hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Disappointing "beach view" room despite good location & beach access
reviews.text: Disappointed that we prepurchased a two night beach view stay and instead got a first floor pool view room with in a very high traffic area ; by ice & vending , bar & service entrance. Staff said beach view reserved for guests staying at least 3 nights! Never stay there again! Too bad as beach access great & room was decent.

We stayed at La Copa after purchasing $99 deal, booked in advanced, checked in earlier than 3. The hotel is average, feels warm and musty in the hallways and elevators. Our rooms on the 3rd floor were below average, carpet looked dirty, towels were dark and worn out, hair found in tub, toilet and counter. The toilet rocked and seat slided to one side. The beds were tempurpedic kind, so comfy, headboard made tons of noise every time I moved. The fan sounded like it was going to fly off. The grill food was gross, do not recommend. We ate at Yummies and Gabriella's both walking distance from hotel, highly recommend both restaurants.
reviews.title: We get what we pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quick access to beach, guests do not care, come in soaked wet, my sister fell walking out of elevator. Breakfast was good, hot eggs and beans, cereals, oatmeal, fruit and bread.
reviews.title: Do not try to cancel your reservation!

reviews.text: Stayed here because of special, we would not stay here again, have stayed in better places in padre.
reviews.title: A little bit unkept

reviews.text: We were looking forward to staying there as our Valentine's Day trip. Four nights, two upper-middle class responsible middle-aged married adults with no children nor pets...the ideal demographic for a hotel. But a death required us to cancel. We canceled, both by telephone and fax, within the required notification period clearly stated in the terms and conditions for our dates. Despite all that work, and leaving two unreturned voicemails with the general manager, we were charged one night. I am still disputing it on my credit card. What a despicable way to run a business. We will NEVER stay there. In 40 years of travel, we NEVER had this issue.
reviews.title: A littke run down and loud

reviews.text: My mom, 3 year old son and I took a weekend trip to South Padre Island and stayed at La Copa Inn. The hallways were full of trash, the stairwells had chicken wing bones and other food items. There was no control of who used the swimming pool. The gate to enter from the beach was not secure and no hotel personnel was at poolside verifying if the people using the pool were guests of the hotel. What made us not want to use the swimming pool was that there were people swimming with the their clothes on - no bathing suits! To me that just seemed gross.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for Spring Break 2012 with three of my girlfriends. The front desk staff was a little rude but expected due to the high traffic flow of check-ins and check-outs. The hotel felt safe and secure despite the time of year it was. I would definately book here again.
reviews.title: Perfect for a girl's weekend!

reviews.text: My friend and I made reservations for five nights at La Copa Inn after a friend, who had stayed there the previous month, recommended I stay there. Upon arrival, I was greeted warmly and my check-in was made extremely easy. My room was spacious, clean, and comfy. The bed was wonderful to sleep in, being that the beds are tempurpedic and the sheets feel soft and fresh to the touch. The housekeeping service was superb, they left the room impeccable and made sure to replace all of our dirty towels as well as provide us with new bars of soap and small bottles of shampoo and conditioner every day of our stay. The small restaurant on the first floor served delicious food that, even though it appeared to be made simple, tasted surprisingly good. The pool, though small, as well as the hot tub, served their purpose and made the stay even more enjoyable. The breakfast that was offered free every morning was a pleasant change from the usual continental breakfast offered by most other hotels as it had warm and appetizing foods as well. The hotel was also located on a great part of the beach and the beach access was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, my stay and experience was pleasurable and I will most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to have a relaxing and wonderful stay at the beach.
reviews.title: Do not come here !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was shocked to read the awful reviews from previous guests since I couldn't relate to their stay whatsoever. On the contrary, I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service

reviews.text: We got a king size bed room, the room is nice and clean, but the staff is awful. They are rude and arrogant, one of the lady broke my ID card thinking it was fake, and the manager clearly told us that they believed the employer and not us, and they did not do anything about it. Everyday we would come back to our room around 5pm and our room was still not cleaned. We had to ask the front desk 2 to 3 times per day to have our room cleaned. The staff barely speak english, and it's always a struggle to communicate. The service is so bad, and they would try anything to make an extra dollar. BE CAREFUL of extra charges while checking in, you will be surprised of what they will ask you to pay for. They are racist and have no people skills.

description: Welcome to La Copa Inn Beach Hotel South Padre Island, Texas. Our beachside hotel across from Queen Isabella Causeway offers an affordable vacation experience in South Padre Island, with five-star resort amenities. We have Spacious Hotel Rooms all with balconies and most with ocean view. All of our rooms feature Tempur-Pedic® mattresses, HD Flat Screen TV with premium cable channels, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, iron and iron board, hair dryer and in-room safe. Other conveniences include complimentary High-speed Internet access and local calls. We have guest rooms for every taste, from standard king or queen beds to our three-room family suite. All rooms are nonsmoking. Our hotel offers an outdoor pool surrounded by a sundeck with a spa tub, chaise lounges, gazebos, and a walkway to the beach. Enjoy our Complementary Hot Full Breakfast buffet, featuring delicious "Belgian Waffles" and the most recent addition "Omelet Station." For your convenience we have complementary Wi-Fi High Speed Internet access available through the entire hotel. A staffed activities desk to assist in planning excursions, coordinate sports-equipment rentals, and sell discounted tickets.
